title: Masked Latent Prediction and Classification for Self-Supervised Audio Representation Learning
author: Aurian Quelennec (LTCI, Telecom Paris), Pierre Chouteau (LTCI, Telecom Paris), Geoffroy Peeters (LTCI, Telecom Paris), Slim Essid (LTCI, Telecom Paris), ... , Institut Polytechnique de Paris
relevance_why: The methods of self-supervised learning for audio representation can be applied to enhance audio generation and processing tasks, particularly in text-to-audio generation, which is a domain of Dr. Liu's focus.
background: The task is focused on developing self-supervised learning techniques to improve representation learning in audio, specifically through combining masked prediction and classification for better audio classification performance.
contribution: This paper introduces MAsked latenT Prediction And Classification (MATPAC) to solve the challenge of audio representation learning, achieving state-of-the-art results on various audio classification benchmarks.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods primarily relied on single-view input or unsupervised classification without joint tasks, leading to limited robustness in representation learning.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves by jointly solving masked latent prediction and unsupervised classification tasks, enhancing the latent representation for downstream classification.

key_innovation: Utilizes a combined approach of masked prediction and classification to create a more informative and robust audio representation for improved performance in classification tasks.
real_world_impact: May lead to better audio classification systems, which are vital for applications in music tagging, environmental sound detection, and multimedia content understanding.

new_terms.masked latent prediction: **Masked latent prediction** refers to the technique where parts of the audio input are hidden or masked and the model learns to predict these masked parts based on visible input.
new_terms.self-supervised learning: **Self-supervised learning** is a machine learning paradigm where the model learns representations from the data itself without requiring labeled data.

open_sourcing: The code and pre-trained weights are publicly available.
